text: there's a disappointing trend going on right now with the classic trio of farm life sims harvest moon story of seasons and now rune factory all having a rough time making the jump from handheld to console rune factory's first dedicated switch game rune factory 5 succeeds largely by clinging to the depth that has earned the series praise in the past unfortunately it can't manage to translate other elements like looking nice or running well in its move from a top-down perspective to a 3d world leaving it in a fun but frequently frustrating spot rune factory 5's abrupt opening sees a young amnesiac hero dropped via portal just outside the backwater town of rigbarth an organization called seed then takes them in as its newest ranger basically a scout crossed with a monster cop as a seed ranger the protagonists can tend to farm run various errands for the villagers and fight off monsters that threaten the town their service quickly takes a cheesy if enjoyable turn into a winding mystery

text: less fun these issues are not limited to movement either as rune factory 5 has aesthetic problems too the jump from top down to third person was a rocky one lacking much of the charm and detail that the worlds of its predecessors were praised for the character design remains stellar especially their dialogue portraits and the animated introductions for bachelors and bachelorettes but the world itself is full of flat textures and long stretches of bland empty space with objects like monsters grass or trees suddenly popping in regularly and frame rate issues whenever there are a few too many things on screen at once and sure when i play a sim like rune factory i can still enjoy it without stellar technical prowess or cutting edge graphics but with a 10 year gap between games i was hoping rune factory 5 would try to be something a little more impressive than rune factory 4 but clunkier rune factory 5 has much of the mechanical depth that made its predecessors so enjoyable but none of the
title: Rune Factory 5 Review
author: IGN

text: factory 5 has much of the mechanical depth that made its predecessors so enjoyable but none of the improvements one would expect from a leap to a new more powerful platform its farming crafting combat and relationship systems remain varied and nuanced satisfying enough to keep me hooked as someone who loves the soothing nature of farming and life sims but i'm disappointed that yet another game in this genre has created an empty technically janky 3d world after years of making rich top down 2d ones especially when the studio behind it clearly has such excellent art chops demonstrated in the occasional animated cut scenes and character portraits it's bad performance didn't necessarily stop me from enjoying the 45 plus hours i dumped into it but it did make that time far more frustrating and it's a shame rune factory wasn't able to make a grander statement in its dedicated switch debut for more check out our reviews of harvest moon one world and story of seasons pioneers of all of town
